comment: PROFESSOR WAS VERY ORGANIZED AND HER D2L WAS SELF-EXPLANATORY. DIDN'T REALLY NEED TO REACH OUT TO HER TO DO EVERYTHING BEIGN EASY. 5 DISCUSSION POSTS AND AN ART MUSUEM REPORT (CAN GO TO THE CAMPUS ONE FOR EXTRA CREDIT) AND SHE HAS 3 EXTRA CREDIT ASSIGNMENTS.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Very easy class with the grade being made up only of discussions posts, tests and the museum report.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I took Professor Bird's online ART 1107 course, and it was a well-structured and straightforward experience. Completing the discussions, tests, and art projects is key to securing a strong grade. Additionally, she offers extra credit opportunities, which can be helpful for students who may not perform as well on tests.

Professor was okay, didn't communicate with students much besides announcements. Actual course is pretty easy, there are discussion ?s every Thursday, a museum report (you visit any art museum and write a paper about an art piece), and 3 extra credit things. Easy A if you do the work!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Bird's class is very straightforward and low-stress. It has five discussion posts, usually between 80 and 100 words, two peer responses, three tests, and one museum report. Additional responses are worth 1 point of extra credit each, and three extra-credit art projects are worth 7 points each. She is not too harsh of a grader, which is a plus.

Professor Bird was great in regard to the course. Only five discussion posts, three tests no lockdown browser, and a museum paper. Her course is a little unorganized and was hard to navigate though. She was also a little hard to get in contact with through email but after sending a follow-up email she usually responds within an hour. Easy A.

I've really wanted to take Islamic Art & Arch and I'm so glad I did! She's passionate and loves this subject. 5 grades in the class; 3 tests, small fun art projects, participation, and a presentation with lots of extra credit. Make flashcards and an essay outline for the tests to be well prepared. Prob the best art history class I've taken at KSU!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I contacted Dr. Bird on several occasions and she responded in less than 24 hrs every single time. I was not looking forward to this course but the material I learned has got me more interested into art. Dr. Bird is passionate and cares about her students. She truly wants to know about our opinions via 4 discussion posts and 1 museum report.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'm not an artistic person so I wasn't sure how I would do in this class. Overall I felt like I learned a lot from Dr. Bird and I understood what I was doing with every assignment. Really easy class with clear assignments. I never even felt the need to email her questions the whole semester, bc I didn't have any.

I hated this class because the whole semester was a mess. The expectations and requirements were so unclear the whole time. I feel like shes taught this class the same way a million times, so in her mind shes throughly explained the assignments, but the reality is she hasnt and its incredibly frustrating. Would NOT recommend.

She cares about the students and is really flexible about tests. If more than half the class didnt get the answer right she marks it off and gives you credit. Shes really sweet and really wants people to be passionate about art.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She gives a huge project like at the beginning of the semester called an art container and that is majority of your grade. she focuses a lot on indian/asian culture and integrating it. she is very opinionated and often goes off topic randomly

She is the best!! You will not regret taking her classes. She is considered to be the Mother Goose of the department. In other words, I'm sad to leave. She is very helpful and will work with you at your pace. She is very sweet but expects greatness at the same time. You will learn a lot. Absolutely recommend her!!

Dr. Bird is the best professor you will have when in the educ dept. She is very helpful and is always willing to help and answer questions. She is not to demanding just expects the best out of you. She really knows how to calm your nerves and preps you for reality. She is funny, sweet, and an excellent teacher. Take her because you won't regret it.
Concepts aren't always clear. But, Dr. Bird is available for aid.  She is interested in her classes and very devoted to ared.
